connectorUiConfig.title: Flare Push Connector
connectorUiConfig.descriptionMarkdown: The [Flare](https://flare.io) connector provides the capability to ingest threat intelligence and exposure data from Flare into Microsoft Sentinel. Flare identifies your company's digital assets made publicly available due to human error or malicious attacks, including leaked credentials, exposed cloud buckets, darkweb mentions, and more.

sampleQueries.query:
FireworkV2_CL 
 | where RiskScore >= 4
 | project TimeGenerated, EventSeverity, EventType, ['title'], source_name, RiskScore, Url
 | sort by TimeGenerated desc

FireworkV2_CL 
 | where EventType == "CredentialLeak"
 | project TimeGenerated, EventSeverity, ['title'], source_name, keyword, RiskScore
 | sort by TimeGenerated desc

FireworkV2_CL 
 | summarize Count = count() by EventSeverity
 | order by Count desc

FireworkV2_CL 
 | summarize Count = count() by EventType
 | order by Count desc

dataTypes.name: FireworkV2_CL
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
FireworkV2_CL
            | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

value:
FireworkV2_CL
            | summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
            | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(7d)

instructionSteps.title: 1. Create ARM Resources and Provide the Required Permissions
instructionSteps.description: This connector enables Flare to send threat exposure data to Microsoft Sentinel. When data forwarding is enabled in Flare, raw event data is sent securely to the Microsoft Sentinel Ingestion API.

parameters.content:
#### Automated Configuration and Secure Data Ingestion with Entra Application 
Clicking on "Deploy" will create Log Analytics tables and a Data Collection Rule (DCR). It will then create an Entra application, link the DCR to it, and set the entered secret in the application. This setup enables data to be sent securely to the DCR using an Entra token.

instructionSteps.title: 2. Configure Flare to Send Logs to Microsoft Sentinel
instructionSteps.description: Use the following parameters to configure Flare to send logs to your workspace.

parameters.label: Entra Application (Client) ID
parameters.placeholder: Deploy push connector to get the App Registration Application ID

parameters.label: Entra App Registration Secret
parameters.placeholder: Deploy push connector to get the App Registration Secret

parameters.label: Log Ingestion URL
parameters.placeholder: Deploy push connector to get the Data Collection Endpoint URI

instructionSteps.title: 3. Configure Alert Channel in Flare
instructionSteps.description: As an organization administrator, you can configure an Alert Channel in Flare to send data to Sentinel.

parameters.content:
1. Authenticate on [Flare](https://app.flare.io)
2. Access the [alerts page](https://app.flare.io/#/alerts?activeTab=alert-channels) to create a new alert channel.
3. Select 'Microsoft Sentinel' and copy the above fields in the form.

For more details, refer to the [Flare documentation](https://docs.flare.io).

dataFlows.transformKql:
source
| extend
    TimeGenerated = iff(not(isempty(timestamp)), todatetime(timestamp), now()),
    EventVendor = "Flare",
    EventProduct = "Firework",
    EventSchemaVersion = "0.1",
     EventSeverity = case(
        toint(risk.score) == 1, "Informational",
        toint(risk.score) == 2, "Low",
        toint(risk.score) == 3, "Medium",
        toint(risk.score) == 4, "High",
        toint(risk.score) == 5, "Critical",
        "Informational"
    ),
        EventOriginalUid = uid,
    EventOriginalType = event_type,
    RiskScore = toint(risk.score),
     Url = url

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: Timestamp when the event was ingested (ASIM)

columns.name: EventSeverity
columns.description: Severity level: Informational, Low, Medium, High, Critical (ASIM)

columns.name: first_crawled_at
columns.description: When the item was first crawled

columns.name: identifiers
columns.description: Array of matched identifiers [{id, type, name, query, group}]

metadata.title: credential-warning
metadata.description: This playbook monitors all data received from Firework looking for leaked credentials (email:password combinations). When found, this playbook will send an email to the email address warning their password has been leaked, recommending appropriate measures if necessary. To learn more about how to connect Firework to Microsoft Sentinel, see the [API documentation](https://docs.flared.io/azure-sentinel-integration).

The Flare Systems Firework solution allows you to receive data and intelligence from Firework on Microsoft Sentinel.

This solution takes a dependency on the following technologies, and some of these dependencies either may be in Preview state or might result in additional ingestion or operational costs.
